description:
Coniophora puteana RWD-64-598 SS2 is a species of wood-decaying fungus belonging to the genus Coniophora. It is a brown rot fungus, meaning it primarily degrades the cellulose and hemicellulose components of wood, leaving behind the more recalcitrant lignin. 

The strain RWD-64-598 SS2 is a specific isolate or variant of the C. puteana species, which may exhibit unique genetic or physiological characteristics compared to other strains or isolates. This particular strain was likely isolated and studied for its wood-decaying properties or potential applications in biotechnology, such as bioremediation or the production of lignocellulosic enzymes.

As a wood-decay fungus, C. puteana RWD-64-598 SS2 plays an important role in the natural decomposition of dead or dying wood in forest ecosystems. Its ability to efficiently break down the structural components of wood makes it a subject of interest for researchers studying wood biodegradation and the development of sustainable wood preservation technologies.
